description:
Are you looking to kick-start a new career as a web developer?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Coding Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (25K-40K) within 20 miles of your location upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part-time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 3 easy steps.Step 1 - Front End CodingComplete a selection of professional and industry-recognised coding courses covering HTML, CSS and Javascript.Step 2 - Back End Coding + Practical ProjectsYou will be studying all the relevant back end coding languages and gaining skills that will qualify you as a fully-fledged web developer. Step 2 is heavily focused on the practical element of learning.Step 3 - Building your portfolioThe final step will be to build your own portfolio website. The portfolio plays a key part in the hiring process as it gives the employer a real insight into your level of ability, creativity and personality.Your Web Developer RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training, we will place you into a Web Development/Software Development role, where you will be guaranteed a 25k-40k salary. We have partnered with a number of large organisations strategically located throughout the UK, providing a nationwide reach of jobs for our candidates.At a one off cost of £1499, or a deposit of £212 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £148, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.
        Show more
        Show less

Oxford£30,000 - £35,000Hybrid WorkingGreat TrainingExciting ProjectsAn ever-growing Greentech company based in Oxford are currently on the lookout for 2 talented and passionate Graduate Developers to join the team. You will have the opportunity to work with and be mentored by some exceptional Developers whilst utilising a modern technology stack. You will have a 2:1 or 1st Class Computer Science (or related) degree and ideally some commercial experience (internship/ placement etc).This will be a predominantly remote role with occasional training/ workshop days in Oxford.All potential candidates should read through the following details of this job with care before making an application.You will have the opportunity to work with the below technologies;JavaSpringBootDockerKubernetesInterviews start next week so if you, or anyone you know are interested in the role contact me as soon as possible.T: 0117 933 1776E: Christian . Lewis at Amber Resourcing . co . ukSoftware Developer | Java | Graduate | Oxford | £30,000 - £35,000
        Show more
        Show less

£25,000 - £35,000 + Training + Progression + Company BenefitsSalisburyAre you a Graduate or Junior Software Engineer who has experience in Embedded technology? Would you like to join the growing research & development team within a global, industry leading company who offer development opportunities, allowing you to become a technical expert?This International Electronics Business has offices in the UK, USA and Hong Kong and specialise in the design and manufacture of data loggers, smart graphic displays and custom electronic products. This company is at the forefront of this Technology and this is an exciting opportunity for someone to join an established company that's building for the future.An opportunity has arisen to join the design department working on data logging products, HMI displays and custom designs for the sensor market with a focus on embedded software and circuits using the latest technologies. The role involves all aspects of full product life cycle, conception, specification, development, testing and ongoing technical support.The ideal Embedded Software Engineer will have Graduated in Electronics or Computer Science, have industry experience developing embedded products using C and a strong working knowledge of digital circuit design.The Role: Overseeing full product lifecycle Developing & implementing software Support for software & hardware testingThe Person:Experience in C Software or Computing graduate Commutable to SalisburyReference number: BBBHKeyword: - HMI, C/C++, Bash, Python, Java, GNU, Linux, Yocto, Qt Creator, touch screens, display, EPOS, control surfaces, engineer, developer, programmer, Cambridge, WFH, hybrid, remoteIf you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitable candidates. The salary advertised is a guideline for this position. The offered renumeration will be dependent on the extent of your experience, qualifications, and skill set.Ernest Gordon Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job, you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at our website
        Show more
        Show less

Based at our Head Office in Whyteleafe, Surrey (just 15 minutes outside of Croydon, easily commutable from London)Competitive hybrid working model – 2 core days at head office and 3 days working from homeGreat benefits including 50% staff discount, company bonus and a day off for your Birthday to name a few! It’s an exciting time of growth and change at Ann Summers, with our Tech project road map in full swing!We’re now on the lookout for a passionate and commercial Front End Developer to join AS Tech and shape the success of our ecommerce projects. This role has an exciting remit, to build the brand’s online vision! As such you’ll be instrumental in supporting the delivery of an elegant user experience across our digital touchpoints. Working cross functionally, you’ll be an incredible communicator who can work collaboratively with teams across the business, building relationships with stakeholders to make a positive impact.A Bit About Ann Summers…You might know us as the inventors of the Rampant Rabbit, or even the destination for must-have lingerie and sex toys, and you’re right, but we’re SO much more than that…We’re an inclusive brand that strives to EMPOWER, lives to PUSH BOUNDARIES, gets kicks off MAKING IT HAPPEN and absolutely LOVES OUR CUSTOMER!Whether you’re working at our head office, in one of our stores, as part of our warehouse operation or as a self-employed Ambassador, one thing that’s guaranteed is no two days are the same. We’re a unique and diverse brand with phenomenally talented experts – together we inspire to achieve the brand’s global vision.Personal Development within Ann Summers…As a brand we’re really passionate about internal progression and take pride in developing our people. In this role you will receive one to one knowledge coaching, an Udemy license and open access to our company L&D platform Thrive.A Bit About The Role…Build efficient and reusable HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Responsible for the maintenance, enhancement and development of Ann Summers websites.Responsible for the deployment of features and updates to website and email to industry. standards whilst supporting a true reflection of brand identity.Build strong, positive and productive relationships with colleagues across the whole of AS, collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders throughout the delivery lifecycle.Impact and support the strategic AS Tech roadmap.Effectively communicate with 3rd parties and stakeholders with development projects with accurate timing estimates.Liaising with designers and programmers for web-based projects.Access and review development team workflow supporting with usability testing.Identifying new & innovative technologies and bringing them to the Digital table.Debug and resolve website bugs whilst maintaining site performance.Responsible for management of site taggingMentor and coach the Junior Front End DeveloperAble to meet the Company`s Values in everything you do.We’re looking for someone who has:Solid experience as a Front-End Developer, ideally in the Retail, Hospitality or Leisure space.Solid technical knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.An analytical mind set, who loves to produce solutions to complex problems.An amazing stakeholder manager and relationship builder, establishing productive internal and external relationships.Able to prioritise and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment, who enjoys a dynamic environment.A person who cares about doing a great job and empower others with the quality of what they do.An affinity with our brand and is an authentic ambassador of our people values.At Ann Summers we are proud to continue embracing inclusion, diversity, and equality in our every day, supporting our people to be themselves. We are committed to building teams with a variety of backgrounds, skills, and views.What’s in it for you?Being part of the AS family offers some fab benefits, not only is it a great brand to be a part of, but not only will enjoy 50% staff discount, but so much more, take a look…29 days Holidays (including Bank Holidays) and additional day holiday up to 35 days for each additional year you’re part of the AS familyAn Udemy academy licenseYour Birthday offCompanywide bonus schemeWorkplace pensionCompany perks schemeHoliday purchase schemeRetail Trust – wellbeing programmeColleague social activitiesAccess to our internal L&D platform - ThriveFree onsite car park at HOSeason ticket loanWe value each one of our colleagues and aim to make Ann Summers a great place to be!We regret that due to high volumes we are unable to acknowledge every application. All successful candidates will be contacted as soon as possible to discuss the role and their experience further.Ann Summers complies with all GDPR policies and by responding to this ad your details will be kept on record for a total of 6 months unless expressed otherwise.
        Show more
        Show less

Are you looking to kick-start a new career as a web developer?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Coding Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (25K-40K) within 20 miles of your location upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part-time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 3 easy steps.Step 1 - Front End CodingComplete a selection of professional and industry-recognised coding courses covering HTML, CSS and Javascript.Step 2 - Back End Coding + Practical ProjectsYou will be studying all the relevant back end coding languages and gaining skills that will qualify you as a fully-fledged web developer. Step 2 is heavily focused on the practical element of learning.Step 3 - Building your portfolioThe final step will be to build your own portfolio website. The portfolio plays a key part in the hiring process as it gives the employer a real insight into your level of ability, creativity and personality.Your Web Developer RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training, we will place you into a Web Development/Software Development role, where you will be guaranteed a 25k-40k salary. We have partnered with a number of large organisations strategically located throughout the UK, providing a nationwide reach of jobs for our candidates.At a one off cost of £1499, or a deposit of £212 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £148, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.
        Show more
        Show less
